values:
In response to Bush's encouraging, honest and vastly blunt. speach today Democratic failure Kerry responded and this is what we know he was actually trying to say.

Estimated Time for success = Artificial timeline for withdrawl.Yet Kerry stated that Dems were not asking for an artificial timeline?

Kerry - every one of us supports the elections in Iraq  [What he meant ] But none of us think we actually went to war legally in the first place so our support is hollow.

Kerry - It is the large pressence of our troops on the ground that is encouraging the insurgency.

[ twopoundradio ] One gerneral made this statement and it was taken out of context. If 80% of Americans support withdrawl, what poll was Kerry even quoting. I haven't seen one poll on the planet backing that up.

Kerry - what does it mean to the troops in Iraq when the debate is going on at home. Kerry stated that they were thanking him for armor etc.

[ twopoundradio ] I have spoken with serveral people in Iraq and some of our troops there. NO ONE is crediting Democrats with any kind of support for this war.

Jack Reed - also addressed Bush's speach stating that it was in-coherent. Really? What part about quitting now and leaving the terrorist in charge was not an option was hard to understand? What part about needing significant Iraq forces in place to protect peace did he not understand? IF this is the best the Democrats have to offer, maybe what we really need is to have Republicans start writing the Democratic responses for them.

In summary - What the average American hears the two parties are saying.

Republicans = We realize the importance of this war and made mistakes early on. We are changing our tactics, better training our fighters and Iraq supporters of freedom.

Democrats = We realize you said this was going to be tough and require sacrifice and we agreed with you but now we are not willing to follow through. Please appease the terrorists by letting them know about when you think we will be giving up.

Al Quida based in Iraq is claiming responsibility for recent bombings in Jordan. (sources coming in the next installment)

This news makes it increasingly curious that the Dems are at war with Bush over this because apparently the administration lied it's way into the war with Iraq. After all didn't the Republicans and even Clinton and Kerry say that Iraq was sponsoring terrorism back in the 90's and even more recently? So for those of you still confused as to Iraq's connection with Al Quida and 911, what more proof do you need. This latest developement only continues to prove we are fighting the right war, in the right place at the right time.

More on this, the WMD factor that is continously ignored by the Dems, what their recent election victories really mean, where the Republican party is going wrong and why even that doesn't seem to help the self destructing Democratic party. In addition, Paris was burning, what has helped contain that and will this happen again. In the next installment.

Quote Of The Week: 10/24 - 10/29
 
Employee - "When I first got here I was overwhelmed with the amount of information we had to take in. Now I can do this job in my sleep."
( apparently a little more than a week later Employee set out to prove his point. )

 
From: X
Sent: Friday, November 04, 2005 8:07 AM
To: X
Cc: X
Subject: Sleeping @ work/ Employee 11/4/2005
Importance: High

FYI,
 
Employee: was found sound asleep on his desk top at 8:00am.  I tapped on his desk as I was passing by him from the printer and he nearly fell out of his chair.  X also approached Employee at about 6:10am and asked Employee if he was awake because he seemed to be sleeping on his desk.  I feel that Employee is ignoring our request not to sleep on his desk top as he has done this in the past and was asked not to do this.

I didn't author this one but I found it strangely accurate. More on Katrina and the Dems descent into oblivian at the Roberts hearings coming soon...

Question: How do you tell the difference between Democrats, Republicans, and Southern Republicans? 


The answer can be found by posing the following question:

You're walking down a deserted street with your wife and two small children. Suddenly, an Islamic Terrorist with a huge knife comes around the corner, locks eyes with you, screams obscenities, praises Allah, raises the knife, and charges at you. You are carrying a Glock cal .40,  and you are an expert shot. You have mere seconds before he reaches you and your family.

What do you do?

Democrat's Answer:

Well, that's not enough information to answer the question!

Does the man look poor? Or oppressed?

Have I ever done anything to him that would inspire him to attack?

Could we run away?

What does my wife think?

What about the kids?

Could I possibly swing the gun like a club and knock the knife out of  his hand?

What does the law say about this situation?

Does the Glock have appropriate safety built into it?

Why am I carrying a loaded gun anyway, and what kind of message does this send to society and to my children?

Is it possible he'd be happy with just killing me?

Does he definitely want to kill me, or would he be content just to wound me?

If I were to grab his knees and hold on, could my family get away while he was stabbing me?

Should I call 9-1-1?

Why is this street so deserted?

We need to raise taxes, have a paint and weed day and make this happier, healthier street that would discourage such behavior.

This is so confusing! I need to debate this with some friends for few days and try to come to a consensus.

Republican's Answer:

BANG!

Southern Republican's Answer:

BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG!

Reload

BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG!

Daughter: "Nice grouping, Daddy! But I think mine are a little closer.  Were those the Winchester Silver Tips or Hollow Points?"

MASSIVELY IMPORTANT LINK OF THE DAY: http://www.hurricanekatrinakidsrelief.org/

BUSH SLOW TO REACT? :  After reading this I hope what occured on President Bush's part will become a lot more clear. I have a friend who comes into the Starbucks I work at. He shead a lot of light on what happened in the first few days of Hurricane Katrina.

He stated their were a ton of helicopters in use when he got there (a day after the hurrican hit). The problem is that because the water levels were so high they had few places in the area to land. SO in effect each helicopter had to make a lot of trips in an out for up to fifty miles to get people to safety and then start over again. "He said alot of the pilots are so commited they are not even going home, they are sleeping under their helicopters and getting back out as soon as they are able to fly". The news is kidding itself if they thought Bush could have predicted this kind of devastation. My friends who's pilot name is Buzzard is headed back out again on 2 hours sleep. He says he has been working over there for days on end even delivering some people here in Arizona later today and tomorrow.

Now stories are also surfacing that in a news conference the day before Katrina hit city leaders in Louisiana stated that President Bush had called them and told them that they should evacuate the city. It is illegal for Bush to have a city evacuated without a government request. Maybe the Dems should be taking this from a different angle. Bush may have acted to quick and outside of his authority, oh my, stop the presses. BUSH DOES CARE AND THE DEMS DON't WANT YOU TO KNOW IT.

Note: When Air Force One flies into Louisianna there is major security protocal to be followed. Essentially all operations in the immediate area must be halted while Air Force One is in the air for around 20 miles or more. That is why he does not just hang out down there everyday.

CASE AND POINT: I find it odd how the major news stations claim to be the first on the spot reporting truth and accuracy that we can all count on. Today some stations are actually reporting what many radio and online sources already knew. While the mayor of New Orleans was throwing a temper tantrum on national tv showing complete grace under pressure saying where is the help in between profanities. The help ( at least 2 Red Cross trucks) were actually being told not to enter the Super Dome because of security concerns. So in effect New Orleans now seemingly somewhat repentant mayor was actually be blindsided by not only his own poor planning but his own Governor.

WHAT WENT RIGHT:  Dispite the above post I DO think it is worth recognizing the police that did stay on the job in New Orleans. Some how officials managed to evacuate 80% of the city according to some estimates. More tomorrow.

I can't promise I will be writing again any time soon. I have however been convicted to set the record straight on how I feel about Hurrican Katrina and the people affected by it from not just New Orleans but Mississippi and Alabama as well.

THE BLAME GAME:  Whenever a vote happens anywhere in the country the Democrats need to go down. I am pretty sick and tired of the Dems fighting with Republicans about who is is fault for the slow response to this hurricane. Now is not the time to start throwing the sickening darts of bitterness, anger and blame. Having said that here are the facts for those who persist in attacking the President. Does the system need to be fixed? I don't think anyone who is intellectually honest will say no. Tonight on the TV in Arizona they are running a telethon to support the victims of Hurricane Katrina. One 67 year old brave black man came on to say that he is also sick of Bush getting blamed. He stated that President Bush would have went down into the water to rescue those most in need if he was allowed closer to the situation in the beginning. And now a brief point on the tale of the tape -

HOW LOUISIANA SPENT PRE-KATRINA FEDERAL FLOOD MONEY: A stunning account in The Washington Post that places more fault at the feet of Louisiana officials for poor flood management: "In Katrina's wake, Louisiana politicians and other critics have complained about paltry funding for the Army Corps in general and Louisiana projects in particular. But over the five years of President Bush's administration, Louisiana has received far more money for Corps civil works projects than any other state, about $1.9 billion; California was a distant second with less than $1.4 billion, even though its population is more than seven times as large." I think this will be the first point of investigation. Dispite this I think we need to forgive and move on.. There is much to be learned here. I do however as usual plan to sift through the usual liberal crap to get through the truth on this.

I do plan to write as long as this is going on.

If you plan to post some well crafted rebutle please donate to someone helping out our fellow Americans affected by the hurricane before you start typing.

Terri Schiavo The Subject of Future Investigation ]

Some likely final thoughts on this. I think that someone will take up this challenge 10 maybe 20 years down the road. Sometime after the dust has settled on one of our nations most embarrassing judicial failures this case may re-open in a different light.

"Dr. Thogmartin said Ms. Schiavo technically died of "marked dehydration" - not starvation - after her feeding tube was removed. [ NY TIMES - the most irresponsible and liberally bias paper on the planet ] But he said the underlying mystery at the heart of her case - why she suddenly collapsed 15 years ago -- could not be answered. He said he considered the manner of her death to be "undetermined." [ twopoundradio ] This is no shocker to anyone actually paying attention to this case. First step in the investigation - solve this major part of the problem.

[ NYT] Instead, the medical examiner discussed some factors that did not appear to lead to Ms. Schiavo's illness. The autopsy, for instance, showed that physical abuse or poison did not play a role in her collapse , he said. Ms. Schiavo's parents, Bob and Mary Schindler, had accused their daughter's husband, Michael Schiavo, of abusing her, which he has steadfastly denied. Dr. Thogmartin also said there was no evidence she had had an eating disorder before she collapsed, although a disorder was widely suspected because she had diminished levels of potassium in her blood.  [ twopoundradio ] In case this wasn't well advertised, this was Michael Schivo main arguement for the collapse. Secondly- I don't think many wounds especially brusing would be apparent years after the abuse would have occured. So this Dr's statement is not a matter of scientific fact, it is a matter of common sense. As for the poison- yeah, forensics don't usually pick that up either without an intensive autopsy that was dis-allowed by Michael himself.

The bottom line. We will likely never know what really happened that lead to Terri's affliction. We all know however what lead to her murder, massive and sickening judicial malice. Welcome to the furture of liberalism in the courts deciding what you can and can't do unless Bush backs someone real, more on this later.

VAN HELSING : (2004)

tagline - The One Name They All Fear....

During the late 19th century, famed monster hunter Dr. Gabriel Van Helsing heads to Eastern Europe to battle with Count Dracula, the Wolf Man, and Frankenstein's Monster. He runs into an untrusting but bold champion of good Anna (Kate Beckinsale). Hugh Jackman could not have been a better pick for the role of Van Helsing and Beckinsale shines in this film as well. The premise for the film is brilliant with Count Dracula seeking to bring his thousands of "born dead" children to life using Dr. Frankensteins Monster and his malicious cohort Igor. The special effects are superb in this film and if you want to call yourself a true fan of the Univeral Monsters of the past, buy this film now. Much like any good monster movie the power against evil ultimately points to Jesus Christ and His servants. This film is well thought out, the characters are enjoyable and the sets are amazing. Please note, Beckinsale's accent in the film is a bit annoying since we know she speaks very good English. Also if you are going to make a movie with Dracula in it from now on you have to call Gary Oldman who played the part to perfection in the 1992 version of Dracula aka. "Bram Stoker's Dracula". The final battle scenes in this movie are top notch. For pure horror fun check this one out, and don't let the nay-sayers get to you. I give this film a 7 out of 7.

UNDERWORLD : (2003)

tagline - An immortal battle for supremacy....

Selene (Kate Beckinsale), a vampire assasin, is entrenched in a war between the vampire and werewolf races. Although she is aligned with the vampires (for no good reason at all), she falls in love with Michael, a werewolf who longs for the war to end. This film opens up with an awesome action scene with Selene and a few cohorts chasing werewolves in a subway station and ends up with a fairly predictable battle between the lead vampire Viktor and Michael. In the middle we learn some more details on the war, Selene's relationship with Viktor and about the corruption of the vampire clan. A couple of common sense ideas are introduced in this film. First off, vampires lie. Not to give away anything but just keep that tid bit in mind. Secondly Kate Beckinsale speaks perfect English which seems to have been a left out little item of interest to the directors of the next movie I am reviewing (also featuring Beckinsale). This film contains a mass amount of blood like any vampire movie but ultimately leaves you thinking, yeah that was cool. If someone recommends it as tonights big rental those who are true vampire fans will at least split the cost. Note: Not for the kids. I give this one 4 out of 7 because not many works come across as being almost part of list of great vampire films as this one does. Also Beckinsale fans will not be disappointed.

THE TIME MACHINE : (2002)

tagline - 0 to 800,000 years in 1.2 seconds....

Based on the classic sci-fi novel by H.G. Wells, "The Time Machine" stars Guy Pearce in the role of scientist and inventor, Alexander Hartdegen, who is determined to prove that time travel is possible. His determination is turned to desperation by a personal tragedy that now drives him to want to change the past. With a time machine of his own invention, Alexanger is hurtled 800,000 years into the future, where he discovers that mankind has divided into your biology teachers heavily flawed evolution theory gone wild. This film has several good points. The first point being that Guy Pearce is actually very good in this film. Anther good point comes later in the film where some very nice camera angles are used to show the speed of the Morlocks (bad guys that look much like the white apes in Congo). The final good point is the sequence in the movie where Alexander finds out a company setting off a bomb on the moon mistakenly, sent the earth out of orbit. This film contains amazing imagination the closer it gets to the end. Unfortunately for this film this is where the story line also gets a bit to bleak for what otherwise seemed like pretty decent exploration of sci-fi. Major issues exist with the ridiculous macro evolution theory shoved in our faces for the storys outcome but if you can overlook that you might enjoy this one. One more note- no matter how much you are into nostalga, this one kills the original. I give it a rating of  3 out of 7.

___________________________________

The obscure rating system I use-

7 out of 7 = This film is a must see- do not wait- get in your car right now even if you have to borrow money.

6 out of 7 = This film is a need to see asap- do not let this film be out more than a week before you check it out.

5 out of 7 = This film is a knee jerk reaction to your friends begging you to see it right away. You won't be disappointed.

4 out of 7 = Great film but you can wait to see it. This film is possibly still worthy of your DVD collection.

3 out of 7 = Good movie, but it won't be remembered for any awards and you will find yourself saying- "you know- so and so was in it."

2 out of 7 = You regret you saw it, but if you are intellectually honest you will admit it had at least 1 redeeming quality.

1 out of 7 = This is the movie you never saw. This is the movie that you were forced to see in a hostage situation. This is the movie                        you ought to be able to sue people over being dumb enough to make.  

More to come...

HELLBOY : (2004)

tagline- Give evil hell .....

In the final days of World War II, the Nazis attempt to use black magic to aid their dying cause. The Allies raid the camp where the ceremony is taking place, but not before a demon - Hellboy - has already been conjured. Joining the Allied forces, Hellboy eventually grows to adulthood, serving the cause of good rather than evil. Much like the Spawn series this hero is also a suppossed demon seeking to do good rather than evil. Oddly this one even relies on Christ (although fairly subtle) in the end for his ultimate reminder that his intended purpose didn't have to define him. In an odd tale of good vs. evil this comic adaptation plays out like neither a film you can really love or hate. Some good points would be Hellboy himself whose character is more like Bruce Willis in Die Hard than anything else. The bad guys are truely truely evil and at points overdone right up to the monsters/demons in the film which all look exactly alike. You would think they could have gotten a bit more creative. Anyway Hellboy's love interest in the film is really under developed and is more like a side note to the real plot. I am not saying this movie had bad acting. It did however lack the orgin layers that any good series should at least dive into with confidence the series will be more than one film..(Hellboy II is currently in pre-production). All in all while there are great special effects and some nice action sequences, this film doesn't leave you say- gee, I ought to see that again. I hope they do better in part II with the developement of characters and perhaps some bad guys that don't appear cloned. I give this film a rating of  2 out of 7. Some times the evil in film is just over the top- this is one of those films. Dispite it's pro-Christ message we loose any real sight of that somewhere in the vortex.

Over the past three days- it was Movie Catch-Up Weekend. The theme-  Action Adventure/ Vampires - (yeah, I know, it seems out of character for me.

THE LEAGUE OF EXTRAODINARY GENTLEMEN : (2003)

tagline- Prepare For The Extraordinary...     

In an alternate Victorian Age world, a group of famous contemporary fantasy, SF and adventure characters team up on a secret mission. Renowned adventurer Allan Quatermain leads a team of extraordinary figures with legendary powers to battle the technological terror of a madman known as "The Fantom." This "League" comprises seafarer/inventor Captain Nemo, vampiress Mina Harker, an invisible man named Rodney Skinner, American secret service agent Tom Sawyer, the ageless and invincible Dorian Gray, and the dangerous split personality of Dr. Jekyll/Mr. Hyde. This film comes out of the gate interesting and just keeps coming after that. Dispite the rash of negative reviews the film got, I liked and recommend it to those solid in their faith. The film does contain it's moments of gore but is mainly marked by it's intense storytelling. Note: If you are not familiar with the characters in the film it may make this one more interesting. Allan Quartermain, Captain Nemo and Tom Sawyer seem greatly out of place in the film since they don't have any supernatural powers and oddly the film points out that Nemo worships the god of the dead? Dispite this the film is outstanding concerning it's effects, we feel sorry for Dr. Jekyll and actually care about Mina Harker the vampiress in the film. Quatermain is certainly likable as well which really makes you want this team to win. The villan "The Fantom" turns out to be largely disappointing because he is a mad-scientist that comes up with futuristic weapons he wishes to sell to the highest bidder during a world war he creates. What isn't disappointing is the final battle scene and the adventure that is this film. If you are looking for some old tales with new twists, you have come to the right place. Rating 4 out of 7. Not for the kids. This film is misunderstood and over complicated by many. Afterall - just the cast would suggest that we shouldn't be subjecting this film to scientific reason or common sense.

 

Movie Catch-Up Weekend Movie Number 2. The theme-  Action Adventure/ Vampires -

SKY CAPTAIN AND THE WORLD OF TOMORROW: (2004)

tagline- Join The Resistance...

Set in New York City circa 1939, the film centers on a reporter who notices that the world's scientists are disappearing. Teamed with a skilled pilot and an adventurous colleague, it's up to her to thwart the plans of a mad scientist bent on destoying the current world and creating a new one. The problem is that at the end of the film we find out- okay well I guess I won't give it away. Anyway dispite the dazzling backgrounds the film style just doesn't seem credible enough to stay interesting. What is interesting is all the different kinds of robots and flying machines in the film. Angelina Jolie's breif appearence in the film almost saves it but nothing could overcome the brilliantly bad acting of Jude Law (Joe "Sky Captain" Sullivan)  and Gwyneth Paltrow ( Polly Perkins). While the film does have a decent paced storyline, the thought of one villian creating such a massive robotic army seems just a bit much. By the way- if you see any films that have both Jude Law and Gwyneth Paltrow at the same time- run for your lives. If you have to pay to see this movie you have already blown it. I do give a nod to the extra effort put into the special effects which makes it one of the few films able to overtake the actors them selves to give it a hint of entertainment value. I give this one a 2 out of 7 rating. Note: Almost no bad language, sci-fi violence but nothing in comparison to what you might see on regular TV just watching previews for other movies.

___________________________________________________________________________

7 out of 7 = This film is a must see- do not wait- get in your car right now even if you have to borrow money.

Terri Schiavo is being murdered as we speak.... and our judges are watching it happen, in fact they ordered it.

I wasn't going to write on this but I feel compelled to now.

A state judge and the U.S. Supreme Court refused Thursday to intervene in the case of Terri Schiavo, leaving the brain-damaged woman's parents with only the slimmest hopes in their fight to keep her alive. Gov. Jeb Bush's request seeking custody cited new allegations of neglect and challenges the diagnoses that Schiavo is in a persistent vegetative state, but Pinellas Circuit Judge George Greer wasn't convinced and declined to hear Bush's arguments.

Even optimists have to admit this looks bleak for Terri. So the questions need to be raised and things need to be answered...

Why would Micheal Schiavo who now has two kids and a live in girlfriend for the past 12 years or so want his wife DEAD so badly? Why has he refused to allow her to get physical theorpy since 1993? Why not try new theoropies that deliver oxygen to the brain that have been successful in treating patients in Terri's situation or worse ? And why has he blocked almost all the nurses testimonies in this case? Remember Terri was going to divorce Michael and had papers ready the day before her heart attack occurred. Secondly multiple examiners are now saying that Terri had injuries consistant with trauma and beatings. So why is the opinion and hear say of a man who likely tried to KILL Terri once before more weighty than a loving families who wants to take care of her? Why was her statement that she was "sickened" when they pull the feeding tube in another case like this, kept out of the courts?

And so there you have it... of course Michael knows we can never find out about what happened the morning of Terri's heart attack because is we do.. we will know the truth. Michael please know this... if you did do this to Terri and you are lying about her wishes... God is watching.

What next people- are they going to kill our 6 month old children because they are in a similar "vegetative state". After all according to the judges feeding someone and giving them water is an "extrodinary medical proceedure."

And what of Planned Parenthood. Well since they make millions on abortion every year, in fact about 75% of their annual income, you won't see them defending life. They love it when woman KILL their children in the womb.

Oh,.. and the ACLU,.... yeah.. they are not for the little man anymore... they are going to be far to busy defending the rapist who killed the 9 year old last week to care about Terri.

Get a good look kids... start realizing how important it is to have judges that don't hate Christ and yes...YOU and me. 

We need to pray hard for our King is listening even when we think He isn't.

In reading one of my friends journals- she posted 26things SWEET guys do...naturally I had to comment. ( my comments in blue)

26 Things a Sweet Guy Would Do

1. Know how to make you smile when you are down.
okay I totally agree here.

2. Try to secretly smell your hair BUT you always notice.
 - uhh- yeah I guess..

3. Stick up for you but still be respectful of your independence.
and sometimes stick up for you in-spite of your independence.

4. Give you the remote control during the game.
unless it hockey. During all other sports the remote must be turned over to the female.

5. Come up behind you, put his arms around you, squeeze you tightly
against his chest, and whisper softly into your ear
unless he whispers- I just got fired for sleeping with everyone on the third floor.

6. Play with your hair.
I think guys like that more than they admit as well.

7. His hands will always find yours.
are you trying to make me cry - you had me at hello....

8. Be cute when he really wants something.
or he could go and get a job, because that will ultimately be more helpful.

9. Offer you plenty of massages.
guilty- I give my wife massages nightly. A loving husband just does that.

10. Dance with you even if he feels like a dork.
guilty also - I am not fat but , I have a bit of a belly so it is extremely funny for her to watch.

11. Never run out of love.
yep.

12. Be funny, but knows when to be serious.
like the time you got in that car wreck, I should have stopped reinacting it over and over with sock puppets. jk.

13. Realize he's being funny when he needs to be serious.
shutting up now.

14................ Be patient when you take forever to get ready.
guys guys just freakin relax, She wants to do the physical part, you need to make sure you do your best to make sure she feels the emotional part.

15. React so cutely when you hit him and it actually hurts.
Guys you should also try not to cuss when you get hurt. It doesn't make the pain go away.


16. Smile alot. :)
very true.

17. Plan a romantic date full of cheesy things he wouldn't normally do
just b/c he knows it means alot to you.
But- try not to be so cheesy that it ruins the romance.

18. Appreciate you.
and appreciate the fact that she has seen you in your darkest hour and still hangs out with you.

19. Help others out.
but don't spend everywaking moment getting tips on how to do that from the Today Show.

20. Drive 5 hours just to see you for 1.
better yet- take a bus for 5 hours to see you on your ten minute break.

21................ Always give you a peck on the cheek when you depart
from each other's company- even when friends are watching.
anything after that thou- you will have to tell them to put their cameras away.

22. Sing even if he can't
he will he will rock you...

23. Have a creative sense of humor.
creative meaning "not always sarcastic".

24. Stare at you.
but not like you just murdered someone and he is wondering how you came up with the strength to pull it off.

25. Call for no reason
"hi, do you have any chapstick. My lips hurt really bad.."

26. Quit smoking, chewing loudly, drinking, or drugs just b/c he loves
you
enough to quit!!
on the serious side - he may quit for awhile but if the reason he quit is truely you then you upset him or you get into a fight- he may use that to get back at your or do it out of habit. If he quits for you but because you make him feel better about himself, he may get to a point where he has enough of his own self esteem to sustain his quitting if you two have fights now and then. Many people who quit souly for their mate however will go back to what they were doing once the relationship breaks down. It is best for each person to instill value in the other so that the result is them quitting, but the reason is their own.

okay that is all...

WASHINGTON (CNN) [ twopoundradio] Did I mention CNN has no love for the Republicans.  -- The top two congressional Democrats made it clear Wednesday night they would fight President Bush's Social Security proposals and press him for a plan to bring home troops from Iraq. [ twopoundradio ] What the Democrats failed to do is lay out an actual plan that detailed a fight. Perhaps- they are taking the "please just don't do anything" approach.

At the same time, Senate Minority Leader Harry Reid of Nevada invited Bush to "join hands and build from the center" in his joint rebuttal to the president's State of the Union address with House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi of California. [ twopoundradio ] Actually this makes perfect sense. The Democrats have become walking contradictions and they should really act that out.

"I want you to know that when we believe the president is on the right track, we won't let partisan interests get in the way of what's good for our country. But when he gets off track, we will be there to hold him accountable," Reid said. [ twopoundradio ] Hmmm - isn't that the job of everyone in Washington ?

Reid said one of Bush's ideas that is off track is his plan to let younger workers put part of their Social Security payroll taxes in personal accounts that they would own, which Democrats refer to as "privatization."Reid termed the idea "dangerous," insisting that it would lead to benefit cuts for retirees. [ twopoundradio ] What part of "no one is losing their social security under a new plan" don't you understand. Thanks Reid - I am glad you have it all figured out for us. "There's a lot we can do to improve Americans' retirement security, [ twopoundradio ] funny- you never mentioned that when Clinton brought it up. but it's wrong to replace the guaranteed benefit that Americans have earned with a guaranteed benefit cut of up to 40 percent," he said.

"Make no mistake, that's exactly what President Bush is proposing."

"But maybe most of all," Reid said," the Bush plan isn't really Social Security reform. It's more like Social Security roulette." [ twopoundradio ] No actually roulette is where you have to spin something around in a circle, but don't worry - I'll let it go for now.

He said Democrats "are all for giving Americans more of a say and more choices when it comes to their retirement savings. But that doesn't mean taking Social Security's guarantee and gambling with it. And that's coming from a senator who represents Las Vegas." [ twopoundradio ] I think this guy might have a gambling issue.

The senator said Bush's Social Security plan would pile an additional $2 trillion on the national debt, which he said was "an immoral burden to place on the backs of the next generation." [ twopoundradio ] What ? This statement makes no sense and has "0" evidence.

Reid said the president's economic polices "have left Americans and American companies struggling." He said Democrats have a different vision: [ twopoundradio ] That different vision is called "corporate well-fare". I am an American - the only thing I am struggling with is the fact that the Patriots are on their way to a third Super Bowl victory in 4 years.

"Spurring research and development in new technologies to help create the jobs of the future. [ twopoundradio ] The new Democratic technology is "how can I possibly clone humans to do my work for me".

"Rolling up our sleeves and fighting for today's jobs by ending the special tax breaks that encourage big corporations to ship jobs overseas."A trade policy that enforces the rules of the road so that we play to win in the global marketplace instead of sitting by and getting played for fools." [ twopoundradio ] Basically he is saying that real poverty in other nations is a great thing.

In her remarks, Pelosi addressed the war in Iraq, saluting Sunday's election there as "a significant step toward Iraqis taking their future into their own hands." [ twopoundradio ] And she also oppossed the war so well - there you go.

She attributed the success of the election to "the courage of our servicemen and women and the determination of the Iraqi people." [ twopoundradio ] What she didn't have was the guts to give any credit at all to Bush who made sure our servicemen were there in the first place.

But having gotten through the election, Pelosi said the United States now "must consider our future in Iraq." [ twopoundradio ] How about concidering Iraq's future in Iraq ? "We all know that the United States cannot stay in Iraq indefinitely and continue to be viewed as an occupying force," she said."We have never heard a clear plan from this administration for ending our presence in Iraq, and we did not hear one tonight." [ twopoundradio ] I wonder if she also wants us to leave Korea ? Granted we all want our soldiers home but our soldiers being over seas is nothing new.

Pelosi said Democrats support a three-point plan to stabilize Iraq and bring the troops home, which includes:

  • Transferring security responsibility to Iraqis as soon as possible.

  • Accelerating Iraq's economic development.

  • Intensifying regional diplomacy to "lessen the political problems in Iraq, take pressure off of our troops and deprive the insurgency of the fuel of anti-Americanism on which it thrives."

    "If these three steps are taken, the next elections in Iraq -- scheduled for December -- can be held in a more secure atmosphere, with broader participation and a much smaller American presence," she said. [ twopoundradio ] Wow- she's is a smart cookie.

    Bush said in his speech that the nation has now entered a new phase in Iraq, with emphasis on training Iraqi security forces so that American troops and its allies there "will increasingly be in a supporting role."

    But he rejected setting a deadline on when U.S. troops should come home: "We will not set an artificial timetable for leaving Iraq, because that would embolden the terrorists and make them believe they can wait us out."

    Pelosi also hit the Bush administration for not doing enough to improve homeland security in the more than three years since the attacks of September 11, 2001. [ twopoundradio ] Actually Pelosi - wouldn't not enough would be the part where we were actually attacked since then ?

    "Despite the administration's rhetoric, airline cargo still goes uninspected, shipping containers go unscreened and our railroads and power plants are not secure," Pelosi said. [ twopoundradio ] So which is it - save the whales and the red crickets, build a "I Don't Like Christians" center for all Democrats to go and marvel at, or feed every starving person on the planet, or oh yeah- put more government regulations on an almost bankrupt airlines so that you can complain about not being able to fly also. Has she forgotten that it was the Democrats who oppossed all of the stuff she mentioned in the first place.

    There was more to all of this but it just go so sad because once again- the far left Dems have completely gone out of their minds and they have absolutely no plans.

Rolling Stone Reverses Decision - Decides to Allow Bible Ad

From the Associated Press:

After first rejecting the advertisement, Rolling Stone sent Zondervan a contract for a half-page ad in the rock magazine's February 24 issue, said Doug Lockhart, executive vice president of marketing at the nation's largest Bible publisher.

Lisa Dallos, a spokeswoman for Rolling Stone publisher Wenner Media LLC, said Tuesday that the company had "addressed the internal miscommunications that led to the previous misstatement of company policy and apologize for any confusion it may have caused."

Grand Rapids-based Zondervan, a division of HarperCollins Publishers, had bought space in the magazine months ago as part of an ad campaign for a new Bible translation aimed at young people, called Today's New International Version.

But about two weeks ago, Zondervan said it was told that Rolling Stone's policy was not to accept advertisements for religious materials.

Lockhart said the contract sent to Zondervan does not require any changes to the ad, which features a contemplative-looking young man and says the new Bible is "written in today's language, for today's times -- and it makes more sense than ever."

"We're thrilled," Lockhart said.

Other media outlets that agreed to carry the ad include Modern Bride, The Onion, MTV.com and AOL, Lockhart said.

[twopoundradio] This news is very encouraging since Rolling Stone pretty much hates God.  Oh- but don't worry if you sing about rape, murder , prostitution, cop killing etc. you are certain to not have any trouble getting an ad anywhere in America.

Okay- enough of that.

NIC U :  I hope this next part doesn't piss anyone off but here goes. My son has mild-grade cerebral palsy. From the number it strikes about 1 in every 2,000 or so kids I think they told us. He just turned 4 this past week and is one of the ultimate JOYS in my life, (along with my wife). Around his second month in the NIC UNIT he needed a blood transfusion or he was going to die. So we called upon our church and others to see if they could donate the blood he needed. Over 45 people were turned away- souly because of the churches annual trip to Mexico including my wife. Fortunately that year I didn't go. Many others were turned away due to drugs in the past, trips overseas, certain diseases, alcholism or alcohol consumption within the last 6 months, and many many other criterias. In fact the test just to get to donate for him was about 100 questions long. Some who in God's mercy I fit the criteria. Logan wound up getting his blood (red blood cells) from me. He would go on... needless to say as a ten week premature premie, my son was suppossed to be born brain dead or serverally damaged, missing organs, blind, deaf, unable to ever breath on his own or walk. He was suppossed to be born in such a way that would cause my wife to bleed to death. I remember sitting with my wife taking this all in.... and then I remember her saying that if she had to die, then that was the way it had to be. She wanted my son to see the world regardless of his condition or what would happen to her. It was that day and every day after that, that I began to understand what kind of a person I was dealing with. My wife is an incredible woman, mother and wife. I come to tears when I think of how and why God would show such incredible mercy on our lives.

My son is still a bit behind in speech and comprehension- but he is far ahead in mechanical manipulation of objects and problem solving. He also sings almost 100 different songs most from memory and somehow once made my DVD player only play DVD's in Spanish for about a week. He walks and ice skates as often as we can get him out to the rink.

Oh- and my wife. Yeah- she is everything I could have ever wanted, and much more than I had ever dreamed.

Sorry I get into this stuff on here- but I am just a bit overwhelmed when I think back on all this stuff.

I have a bunch more studies to get through on the Significance of Man- I apologize to any of you actually reading those. I have the next one done- I just need to get it posted. Having said that I leave you for the night with this....

One night in Bangkok

THE AMERICAN:

Bangkok, Oriental setting
And the city don't know what the city is getting
The creme de la creme of the chess world in a
Show with everything but Yul Brynner

Time flies -- doesn't seem a minute
Since the Tirolean spa had the chess boys in it
All change -- don't you know that when you
Play at this level there's no ordinary venue

It's Iceland -- or the Philippines -- or Hastings -- or --
or this place!

COMPANY:

One night in Bangkok and the world's your oyster
The bars are temples but the pearls ain't free
You'll find a god in every golden cloister
And if you're lucky then the god's a she
I can feel an angel sliding up to me

THE AMERICAN:

One town's very like another
When your head's down over your pieces, brother

COMPANY:

It's a drag, it's a bore, it's really such a pity
To be looking at the board, not looking at the city

THE AMERICAN:

Whaddya mean? Ya seen one crowded, polluted, stinking town --

COMPANY:

Tea, girls, warm, sweet
Some are set up in the Somerset Maugham suite

THE AMERICAN:

Get Thai'd! You're talking to a tourist
Whose every move's among the purest
I get my kicks above the waistline, sunshine

COMPANY:

One night in Bangkok makes a hard man humble
Not much between despair and ecstasy
One night in Bangkok and the tough guys tumble
Can't be too careful with your company
I can feel the devil walking next to me

THE AMERICAN:

Siam's gonna be the witness
To the ultimate test of cerebral fitness
This grips me more than would a
Muddy old river or reclining Buddha

And thank God I'm only watching the game -- controlling it --

I don't see you guys rating
The kind of mate I'm contemplating
I'd let you watch, I would invite you
But the queens we use would not excite you

So you better go back to your bars, your temples, your massage
parlours --

One night in Bangkok and the world's your oyster
The bars are temples but the pearls ain't free
You'll find a god in every golden cloister
A little flesh, a little history
I can feel an angel sliding up to me

One night in Bangkok makes a hard man humble

A co-worker of mine also works at Food For The Hungry. So I thought you all might want to check out some impactful giving - ps. feel free to skip this if you like, it is mainly for informational purposes...

Donating is considered the best way to help those affected by the tsunami in Indonesia, Sri Lanka and other lands. Food For The Hungry already has a strong presence in the area - You can donate at www.fh.org  or call 1-800-2-HUNGERS.

$25.00 - will buy 12 body bags and coffins and transport them to a morgue or gravesite.

$50.00 - will pay for the food being distributed to 30 families each day or immediate/emergency supplies for four families for one week.

$100.00 - will purchase a one week survival pack for 8 families.

To find out more you can call the number posted above.

Over this past week I have seen a few rentals- Yes they are old news- no, I don't get out to movies that often so rentals are pretty much the way it goes right now.

NAPOLEAN DYNOMITE : An alienated teen decides to help his new friend win the class presidency in their small town high school, while he must deal with his bizarre family life back home. After hearing about this movie for months I had actually become quite capable of having a serious conversation about the film before I even saw it. This film is already an "Office Space" callibur kult classic. The film is plagued by it's $20.00 dollar budget and extremely weak acting like most kult films however this one contains an uniquely watchable ingredient that almost begs you to fall in love with it's extremely shallow characters. This film masterfully handles the personalities of at least 3 or 4 kids you know in highschool. I think it is because of it's strikingly familiar themes and ecced clever randomness that this film will be known as a love or hate film. I personally loved it- however I can also see why some people hated it. On the   rating system this puppy gets 5 out of 7. tagline from the movie- He's out to prove he's got nothing to prove.

OPEN WATER : Based on the true story of two scuba divers accidentally stranded in shark infested waters after their tour boat has left. Let me give a few warnings here. 1) This film is not easy on the stomach. Not because it is incredibly gross but because the camera seems to float for large portions of the movie along with the characters. 2) The characters in the film are fairly likeable which makes the ending just completely suck. Open Water is one of those "maybe I should have seen that coming" movies. It is also shot on a low budget and it equally lacks any good acting at all. Having said that- the film does it's job of making you feel crappy and wondering why you just spend 1 hour and 20 minutes waiting for it's grim ending. If you ignore this film you aren't missing out on much. If you do see it perhaps you will notice the completely idiotic steps taken that lead to the divers getting stranded and the idiotic steps taken that kept them that way. As a FAN of shark films- this is one I would gladly have done without. This one gets 2 out of 7 mainly because there were actually some funny moments and the film does dive a bit into what it means to love someone in a really intense environment. tagline from the movie - Drifting into theaters this summer.

The obscure rating system I use-

7 out of 7 = This film is a must see- do not wait- get in your car right now even if you have to borrow money.

6 out of 7 = This film is a need to see asap- do not let this film be out more than a week before you check it out.

5 out of 7 = This film is a knee jerk reaction to your friends begging you to see it right away. You won't be disappointed.

4 out of 7 = Great film but you can wait to see it. This film is possibly still worthy of your DVD collection.

3 out of 7 = Good movie, but it won't be remembered for any awards and you will find yourself saying- "you know- so and so was in it."

2 out of 7 = You regret you saw it, but if you are intellectually honest you will admit it had at least 1 redeeming quality.

1 out of 7 = This is the movie you never saw. This is the movie that you were forced to see in a hostage situation. This is the movie                        you ought to be able to sue people over being dumb enough to make.

(Matt 1:18-25)

And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered. 2 This census first took place while Quirinius was governing Syria. 3 So all went to be registered, everyone to his own city.

4 Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David, 5 to be registered with Mary, his betrothed wife, who was with child. 6 So it was, that while they were there, the days were completed for her to be delivered. 7 And she brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped Him in swaddling cloths, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.

8 Glory in the Highest

 

Now there were in the same country shepherds living out in the fields, keeping watch over their flock by night. 9 And behold, an angel of the Lord stood before them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were greatly afraid. 10 Then the angel said to them,"Do not be afraid, for behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy which will be to all people. 11 For there is born to you this day in the city of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord. 12 And this will be the sign to you: You will find a Babe wrapped in swaddling cloths, lying in a manger."

13 And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying:

14 "Glory to God in the highest,And on earth peace, goodwill toward men!"  

15 So it was, when the angels had gone away from them into heaven, that the shepherds said to one another, "Let us now go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has come to pass, which the Lord has made known to us." 16 And they came with haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the Babe lying in a manger. 17 Now when they had seen Him, they made widely known the saying which was told them concerning this Child. 18 And all those who heard it marveled at those things which were told them by the shepherds. 19 But Mary kept all these things and pondered them in her heart. 20 Then the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told them.

By GEORGE EDMONSON
COX NEWS SERVICE

[twopoundradio] Shaky source but oh well. I can't stand Cox right now. 

WASHINGTON -- The manufacturer of Humvees for the U.S. military and the company that adds armor to the utility vehicles are not running near production capacity and are making all that the Pentagon has requested, spokesmen for both companies said.

[twopoundradio] Hmmm- sounds like a bunch of job openings coming up here folks.

"If they call and say, 'You know, we really want more,' we'll get it done," said Lee Woodward, a spokesman for AM General, the Indiana company that makes Humvees and the civilian Hummer versions.

[twopoundradio] I think Rumsfeld really dropped the ball here. Granted armor "wasn't" a huge issue during the first Gulf war but we are up against a non-conventional hate machine that doesn't play by the same "mother of all wars" rules that Saddam did. There is simply no excuse for our army not having this stuff by now. Dispite the fact that Rumsfeld was brutally honest when getting questioned on this, he failed to give any kind of assurance on the issue. This all still doesn't make up for the excuses.

At O'Gara-Hess & Eisenhardt, the Ohio firm that turns specially designed Humvees into fully armored vehicles at a cost of about $70,000 each, spokesman Michael Fox said they, too, can provide more if the government wants them.

Sen. Evan Bayh, D-Ind., said yesterday that the companies could increase production of armored Humvees from 450 a month to 550 by February.

I also did not like Rumsfelds statement that "we go to war with the army we have, not the army we wish we had." I rarely get upset but Rusfeld's statements but this is one of the weakest excuses I have heard. He is acting as if this is the first time he has ever heard a complaint about this. Bush told us all that we were fighting an unconventional enemy so the theory in an of itself is nothing new.

Blaming the shortage on a lack of production capacity, as Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld did Wednesday, is "just not true," said Bayh. He said he had told the Pentagon as early as April that more armored Humvees could be built.

"It's essentially a matter of physics," Rumsfeld told the soldiers in his reply on Wednesday. "It isn't a matter of money. It isn't a matter on the part of the Army of desire. It's a matter of production and capability of doing it."

[twopoundradio] So Rumsfeld makes an open statement that it is an issue but does not say they are going to get it done. I stongly support this effort but we can not continue to thing without the use of all of our needed resources. Rumsfeld for the first time in awhile seemed off guard, and not very confident of any real plan to get this all done as fast as possible. So now we can all watch what the overall response will be. President Bush - the time for talk has come to an end, a swift pro-active response is needed.

"Come on an breathe, breathe away, continuation of my day, and all the time, locked in the dungeon, of your pain, come on and see, see a way, far away from you and me, you can crush me, by the noise from your voice, at the speed of sound, sometimes to the ground, come on and speak, speak the way, you did when you thought we knew what we were doing,

"and that all the risks were worth what we'd eventually pay price tags on."

and I can pay, come on and touch, touch the way, you used to touch me when we knew it was love, but I still hold on, and I know you hold on, when it comes to faith, everybody's scared of the truth that I am not enough alone to really love you, unless I change, unless you change,

"just because I like weird things, and you like even weirder things doesn't mean we belong together I might just be that we are screwed up and need help."

so come and see, see a way, for you and me, the whole of fears, and all of it's sums, something holy this way comes." 

JH-2002

[COX IS FINALLY GETTING ON MY LAST NERVE:] Once again on my two major days to update this thing- my COX is out of commission. Last week we called the tech guys who blamed in on our computer. That is on Sunday and Monday- my most busy days. Today the home system is down so I am doing this all on my work break. I personally think cats have always been more feminine than masculine so perhaps most people thought I was either a girl or looked like a puppy dog of a guy. Anyway your feedback is certainly welcome.

[WHAT IS THIS CRAP:] Today most of the day I have heard more and more issues with people having trouble with Christmas and people saying "Merry Christmas." The arguement here is that religious people and Christians are shoving their version of Christmas on to the secular population. If Christmas is so offensive to people why didn't the nay-sayers say nay way back when- oh lets say hundreds of years ago. Anyway I know that the weak minded and easily offended get upset about Christians saying Christmas and Merry Christmas and putting up crosses, Jesus birth, Christmas trees, etc. every year. It just seems to be "extra-bad" this year. Yes- "EXTRA BAD" I say!

[BACKGROUND:] Okay- I know this time of year is tough for a lot of people. I also think pain is relative so I can not dismiss the pain you went through as a child or whenever as anything less than you percieve it. In other words if you have never been punched, then a pinch would hurt a lot in your eyes. If you had never been stabbed, then a punch would hurt a lot and so on... Each cause of pain has it's merit. Growing up in an alcholic home with pretty much no father (all though we did get evidence-lessly beaten up by him on the weekends) it would follow that Christmas time would have been freakishly miserable for my brother and I. Perhaps for him in some ways it was but generally I think he and I both looked forward to getting our lawn mowing money or allowance together to get presents for each other. My mom dispite her issues always loaded us up on presents after saving for the entire year, and not just stuff she thought we should have, but stuff we liked. We rarely had a tree but my mom would decorate the with cards we'd gotten and made a tree shaped design with Christmas tree decorations from a tree we had years before. The day itself usually consisted of getting up at 6am. opening presents and then going to my grandma's and finally my dads. Dad pretty much only got us money unless he was with a wife that demanded he go out and buy something. (my dad has been married 7 times). Our family engaged in the usual arguements and any mention of Christ was usually dismissed by my father at least as "not real" he once told me "he was god". Yet other times that night or a night later my mom would get depressed about one thing or another and go out and get drunk. Sometimes especially when we were young not returning for days. It wasn't until after high school that my mom would finally turn it around and shake her drinking for good. We are slowly building our relationship now as the pieces are slowly put back into place.

The common thread between her and I is Jesus Christ. She became a active Christian when I was probably 20 or so, but had always taught me about Jesus long before that. She read to us from Bible stories (truths) since we were very young. As I reflect- rather fragmentedly on my past and Christmas itself, it has only been about Christ for me since around 1997. The year I met my wife. I think she was able to take me back to a place where Christ was the main thing and everything. Back to a place I hadn't been but was so familiar with and at home with that it was impossible to escape...nor do I ever want to. As the day we celebrate Christ's birth approaches, I invite you as my pastor has invited me to investigate the first 4 verses of the gospel of John. I will be doing so right here on this journal if my internet works this evening. I think these verses are the beginning of hope and the identificating nature of the great healer, Savior and Lord of Lords. As we ourselves begin to shine, I think we hold on to one of many hopes that our family and friends are able to comprehend it.

[THE POETRY]  I will be posting more of my own soon but I wanted to give a special thanks to who is giving friends the priviledge of reading some of her poetry which is just flat out amazing.
Here ya' go- for those who thought perhaps I actually was a cat...

[ SUPER SENSATIVE ]
"YOU SAY i'M SUPER SENSATIVE,
FIND ME SOMETHING TO CONTROL,
TAKE ME ON, HEAD TO HEAD AND SOUL TO SOUL,
DO YOU REALLY WANT TO SEE HOW DARK IT IS INSIDE,
DO YOU REALLY WANT TO KNOW,

YOU BREAK MY WALLS WHEN i GIVE YOU PERMISSIONS,
WALK INTO MY HIDDEN ROOMS,
YOU BETTER KNOW WHAT YOUR GETTING INTO,
I'VE WALKED A THIN LINE BETWEEN YOURS AND MY MINDS,
I THINK YOU KNOW AND YOU THINK IT'S ME,
MIGHT I FIND A WAY,
( I take every word in because I am ultradramatic )

I PULL AT EVERY NERVE,
I PULL AT EVERY VEIN,
I DON'T SETTLE FOR COMFORTABLE,
I HOPE THIS THING REMAINS,
MY LIFE HAS BEEN ONE OF BLACK AND GREY,
BUT I'VE JUST SEEN HOPE,
WONDER WHAT YOU'LL SAY,
(WHAT WILLYOU SAY TO ME ?)
IF YOU FIND OUT I BLEED, IF YOU FIND OUT I CRY,

YOU SAY I'M SUPER SENSATIVE,
YOU SAY I'M SUPER SENSATIVE,
YOU SAY I'M SUPER .... SENSATIVE..
MIGHT I FIND MY WAY,
MIGHT I FIND A WAY."

JH' 2003-4.

[COX is not my friend right now] My usual days to catch up on all my online stuff is Wednesday and Thursday then usually Friday night late. Having said that several updates here on the journal have simply not posted at all. The reason COX, yes my high speed internet provider is failing me drastically at almost every turn. I think they need to give me a month free since almost all my posts recently have had to come from work on breaks.

[so whats next] Right now I am working on the 7th installment of my significance of man study in the Bible. I have met some who's view differ from what I have posted but hopefully by the end of the study it will all make sense. Also- there are some high quality comments coming from the LEFT that I need to address here on Friday so yes- I will finally be revisiting the political arena. Also more poetry is on the way as early as tonight.

[personal stuff] At work last night my team of around 11 phone representatives presented me with some cash. The company has a Christmas party coming up on the 17th that I would love to go to but my 3 year old son wouldn't be able to attend. Hence the need for a babysitter we (my wife and I) can't afford to bring in for a night right now. Enter my loving team and their contribution. I think as a team lead you always want to make an impact on your team but apparently mine has been fairly significant. It almost put my into tears to know that they are seeing how much I actually do care about them and their personal goals. It makes me think that in fact the age old lie that you can not manage effectively if your team actually likes you, is just that- a lie.

Also on the scary but cool front my wife quit her highest paying but most stressful job. She had been juggling 3 for over a year now. The good news here is that for about 20 more hours a month she will actually be available for our son and myself. The other good news is that regardless of what seems to happen God does not cease to stop blessing us and lifting us up. I have always been in love with Jesus Christ but it is times like this that you can see He and He alone holds this family together. The timing also could not be better. Our son has mild grade cerebral palsy which has him delayed in some aspects of life up to about a year. To catch him up he undergoes 3 theropy sessions a week right now. The people that oversee his progress outside of us are promoting another 2 theropy sessions for each week. This means our son will be getting some excellent help in even more areas than before. While some parents pull away from their handicapped kids, my wife and I see our son for what he really is- a great and wonderful gift from God.
